page.title: 16Home Life in Uzmaston area
page.content: Most people work near home and many wives have jobs. Evenings and week ends are taken up with domestic duties, gardening, home decorating, car maintenance, hobbies, study, entertainment and entertaining. Children are generally encouraged to go to a place of worship, to Guides, Scouts or other youth group, music or dancing lessons and to take part in sport. Parents support their children's activities and provide transport. Adults also have outside interests - sport, council work, voluntary organisations - often raising money for charity. They attend evening classes in many subjects. Many homes have central heating, automatic washing and drying machines, fridges, freezers and microwave ovens. Cooking and heating is by electricity, gas, coal, oil, wood or calor gas.
